newsitem.title: USA: INSIGHT - Dollar seen treading path lower near term.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Dollar seen treading path lower near term.

text.p: Chartists warned that the dollar may be headed for further downside tests that could soon push the U.S. currency below the 1.70 marks threshold.
The dollar was last below that level on April 22, when it traded at 1.6958 marks.
"The fact that we broke through that support (at 1.71 marks) is not a good sign," said Randolph Donney, director of capital markets research at Pegasus Econometric Group.
"We may just trade down towards that 1.6960 area sooner rather than later," said Donney, adding that could happen in the next day or two.
Donney noted that a major grouping of lows from April 21 and 22 are clustered near 1.6960 marks.
The dollar opened at 1.7120/30 marks on Thursday, but by midday, it had tumbled to 1.7070/80 marks.
Chartists also identified levels of support for the dollar prior to the 1.6960 marks level.
Donney cited Bollinger band support on the daily technical charts at 1.7045 marks.
Indeed the dollar had briefly dipped to 1.7045 marks during U.S. dealings on Thursday.
Below 1.7045 marks, MCM CurrencyWatch senior technical analyst Scott Siller pegged dollar support at 1.70 marks.
The dollar looks like it will test 1.70 marks, a 50 percent Fibonacci retracement of the move from 1.6615 on March 31 to 1.7395 on April 28, according to Siller.
"Daily studies are bearish and the weekly studies are now starting to kick in. And a few more down days like this, and I could see a major, major correction in the dollar," he added.
Against the yen, the dollar was barely changed in U.S. dealings, trading at 123.75/80 at 1300 EDT/1700 GMT versus 123.72/77 at the open.
Siller noted that a rising support line dating back to February 28 comes in in the area of 123.25 to 123 yen.
He warned that a decisive loss of support at 123.25 to 123 yen could "open a can of worms."
Specifically, he said that could open up a test of 122.40 yen and 120 yen.
The dollar last traded below 123 yen on April 4, when it hit an intraday low of 122.40 yen.
